title: German Research Reveals Expectations Plus Prior COVID-19 Vax Link with Adverse Events—The ‘Nocebo’

opengraph.description:
German researchers led by Ingmar Schäfer, Ph.D., Institute and Outpatients Clinic of General Practice/Primary Care, University Medical Center Hamburg-Eppendorf published in JAMA Network Open conducted a prospective cohort study investigating the links between expected benefits and risks of vaccination, adverse events at first vaccination and observed adverse effects in close contacts with the severity of systemic adverse effects among adults receiving a second dose of mRNA COVID-19 vaccine between August 16 and 28, 2021. Targeting a primary outcome associated with a composite severity index of systemic adverse effects across 12 symptom areas measured once daily via electronic diary over seven consecutive days,  the study team collected and analyzed data by mixed-effects multivariable ordered logistic regression adjusted for prevaccine symptom levels as well as observed times. 
What were the results?
